data.title: Class Reunion
data.text: We had a nice time at the hitachi bar with table side cooking. Food is always good and nice friendly wait staff.

data.title: Tempura
data.text: Very nice and quiet restaurant.  Really enjoy their lunches..  You get a lot for a great price.  The food is prepared nicely and the staff is very friendly.

data.title: Vegetarian sushi options!!
data.text: Good food at a reasonable price, and they have lots of vegetarian options (including sushi!!!) My wife and I went and had the avocado roll and the Yaki Soba the first time and both were very tasty. The service was fast and friendly. We then went a few weeks later with some friends and got the avocado roll again and veggie fried rice. The fried rice was very tasty and reheated well the next day (huge portions). Our friends got a beef dish and a chicken dish and they approved of both. I also had the amber bock the first time and it was tasty too. The ambience isn't the greatest, but it is definitely the best sushi in Temple, and worth checking out. Don't worry about reservations, it has always been empty when we go.

data.title: Best Show in Town and You Get to Eat the Props
data.text: Fabulous preparation of hibachi grill food. If you want the chef and the whole presentation, go with four or more people or you will have to wait until enough are seated to begin a cooking session. The prices are very reasonable, and you get soup, salad and entre and a drink for about $11. Yes, if you have eaten there 7, 8 or 9 times, the show is the same, but you still come back because of the food. You always leave full, and they also have side dishes (sushi) you can add to your meal.

data.title: Japanese Steak House not recommended
data.text: Dirty, room we sat in looked like it was falling down and right next to kitchen in the back. Food was ok but not up to par against other Japanese steak houses. Cook did put on a good show.

data.title: Good food--awful service!
data.text: Went there for lunch for my birthday.  We were told to "seat ourselves".  Had to ask for a menu.  We ordered two bento boxes and a scallop hibachi--with fried rice. One of the bento boxes came with chicken instead of beef, and the scallops came with steamed rice. There was no acknowledgement of the wrong items, and I had to ask for a refill for my iced tea. We had to request our ticket, and after waiting quite a bit, asked the person clearing tables to take care of our bill.  All we heard from our waiter was, "Not a problem!"  There was a problem with service--and I don't know how they can stay in business with this kind of service!

data.title: Your Sushi Stop
data.text: If you are craving sushi then this is the place to go. I tried sushi for the first time here and have been hooked ever since. Nowhere else compares to Nami's. They have a great selection with proportional sizes. They also have happy hours for sushi!! You need to try this place!

data.title: Good Food and Tasty
data.text:
Would highly recommend.  this place is spot on for asian and sushi
little hard to access the location on 195 and I35 but well worth it.

data.title: Great Lunch Spot
data.text:
We enjoy Nami's in Temple for Lunch.  We get the Bento boxes.  It contains a good variety of foods and we get to relax and have a conversation about our day.  Our Server, Kasarah, does a wonderful job.  DJ, the sushi chef, always amazes us with his creations.
I recommend you visit and enjoy a great meal.

data.title: Large group dinner
data.text:
Had a dinner party here on a Friday in January with about 25 people. Granted that is a very large group, but we didn't sit hibachi side. We had one waitress, and she showed no care in the world. I believe she knew she would get the 18% gratuity, and she didn't want to work any harder for another penny. 
The food was fine, but I just couldn't get over how little she was trying. She would set all the soups/salads on one end of the table and we had to pass them down. While taking orders, she moved quickly, saying "next", "next" etc. Quite rude.  

I'm sure the service is usually better with normal sized groups, I just wouldn't recommend having parties here

data.title: Top Notch Service
data.text: Been wanting to try this place for the longest time! Heard and saw many yummy things coming from this location so couldn't wait to try. The owner is one of the nicest, kindest and generous man ever! So if you ever visit, ask to meet him and he will give you the 5 star treatment :) We received that that night when he happened to be there. He had the sushi chef prepare a crab salad and it was delicious. Very filling with lots of crabmeat. We ordered an eel rool and a rock and roll roll and they were huge! These could be the meals in itself but I love katsu so I got the pork katsu. It wasn't bad at all. The chicken yakisoba my daughter got was delicious! Way better. I can tell that their hibachi would be great based on this yakisoba! Suffice to say we were stuffed but we had to try their specialty dessert which was the cheesecake roll. Ok have to admit this was too funky for me but my daughter and my husband (when we brought some home) liked it a lot. It was soo filling and very unique. YOu just have to try it yourself. You can tell many local keep coming back here based on the reception. We wish we lived nearer to we can frequent here more but its a cute little place-inside is dark and way bigger than it looks from the outside. Its a little hole in the wall in smack of small Temple downtown but I can tell its well-known. Definitely so glad we go to try this since it was on our way home. I would love to have more noodle and sushi dishes next time aroun definitely. I am still thinking about their veggies-they are so fresh and crunchy. I like that :p Had a fun experience-thank you Nami! I wonder if their other locations are just as good? They have 2 others I believe..would love to see!

data.title: Absolute best hibachi restaurant in Texas!
data.text: Get the Benihana experience at 1/3 the price, with much more family orientation.  Both Belton and Temple locations have excellent food with the newer, and more historic location in Temple being in the heart of a revitalized downtown.

data.title: Hibachi and Sushi!
data.text: I came here with a group of friends for my birthday and they provided excellent service and the food was delicious. We did the Hibachi and had an excellent cook who was entertaining and interacted well with us. I loved their seaweed salad and the sushi was fresh and tasted excellent. They had some decently priced cocktails and beers.

data.title: Seafood
data.text: Wonderful food and atmosphere.  They cook your food right in front of you and the chef is wonderful.  Had everyone laughing all night.  I loved it.

data.title: Good Experiecne
data.text: Great hibachi restaurant.... worth during lunch , a little pricey for dinner. Very good sushi. Great for a family outing and also with friends.

data.title: Our favorite hibachi around
data.text: Nami is the place everyone in our family wants to celebrate their birthdays. Besides the fantastic food and show, the cooks are fun and put on a great show. Birthday celebrations enjoy a crazy birthday song, hat and slice of comp cheesecake.

data.title: Good Food and Good Prices
data.text: We've eaten at both the Belton and Temple locations and both provide good food at a good price.  Nami's offers a wide variety of Japanese and Chinese dishes as well as an extensive Sushi menu.  You have the option of eating at a regular table or having the food prepared at the grille.  All the dishes we've tried have been well prepared and flavorful.  The only glitches we've experienced were related to service--we ordered Sushi, but the order was lost and we ended up cancelling it because our entrees had already been served.

data.title: Good hibachi and sushi!
data.text: Located in downtown Temple. It's never very crowded in the main (non-hibachi) dining area. At least one day a week they run sushi specials, but it's changed a few times so I would recommend calling to confirm the day(s)/timeof their sushi happy hour. I always get sushi rolls and my husband always gets hibachi - we have been pleased everytime!

data.title: Family Favorite
data.text: My family and I love Nami's. The atmosphere is fun and energetic without being loud and chaotic. When we go, we typically take our kids (ages 7 and 10) and have been for years. It is definitely something the whole family can enjoy. We always eat at the Habachi grill and it is usually the reason we love it so much. Most of the Habachi cooks are very animated and are great with kids. We also occasionally go with friends from work. Their dinner portions are very generous. We usually leave with tons of left overs to eat the next day. Lunch portions are just right... enough to leave you stuffed (usually no leftovers) but at a cheaper price. The YUM YUM sauce is a must!!

data.title: Wonderful food, Sushi is best in town... Service is worst in town
data.text:
Nami's always produces a good quality regarding the food.  Their sushi is fresh, well prepared by the chefs, and typically consistant.  This has been the case for years, but the service has been hit or miss for the same period, with a trend toward worse service in the past year or so.  It's disappointing that such good food can be accompanied by such poor customer service and just bad table service.
The food is good, sometimes not as good as the price would suggest, but it's consistantly good on the sushi side of the house.  The habachi grill is okay, but be prepared for inconsistant quantities of food and really poor servcie from the wait staff.
I still go back frequently, but not as much as I would like to if the issues were resolved.
